oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On a question of Huneke-Jaffe concerning seminormality
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SINGH, B
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: seminormality.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We answer a question of Huneke-Jaffe in the negative by constructing an example of a ring A containing a non-zerodivisor t such that A/tA is a seminormal integral domain but A is not seminormal. We also show that this example is universal among such examples.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Joint International Meeting of the American-Mathematical-Society/Indian-Mathematical-Society-on-Commutative-Algebra-and-Algebraic-Geometry,Bangalore, INDIA,DEC 17-20, 2003
